text: Chavda, (Gujarati:ચાવડા), (often spelled Chavada, Chawada, Chawda, Chawara or Chapotkata) is prominent in the Gurjar ethnic community. They are predominantly found among Hindu Gujjars, but there are some Muslims as well. ==Geographical distribution== Some Chavda Gurjars can be found in Punjab, Pakistan, although they are mostly found in Indian states of Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Jammu and Kashmir, and Gujarat. ==References== ==Further reading== * Radhakumud Mookerji (1912) Indian Shipping: A History of the Sea-borne Trade and Maritime Activity of the Indians from the Earliest Times Longmans, Green and Company. p. 169 * James M.Campbell (1901) Gazetteer of the Bombay Presidency: Volume 9, Part 1 Printed at the Government Central Press. p. 480 * Krishna Chandra (1992) Sagar Foreign Influence on Ancient India Northern Book Centre. p. 254 * Krishna Chandra Sagar (1992) Foreign Influence on Ancient India Northern Book Centre. p. 254 Category:Social groups of Gujarat Category:Social groups of Rajasthan Category:Gurjar clans Category:Gurjar clans of India
title: Chavda Gurjars
